chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant William Anthony Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution in the amount of $6,271.81 payable to Christopher M. and $669.21 payable to Nancy M. Restitution is ordered / joint and several with co-actor Marquez L Zeigler 22CF1907.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Obtain a high school diploma or GED.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm and body armor possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*NO CONTACT with victims.
*NO CONTACT with co-actor.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete an anger management course.
- Complete a cognitive intervention therapy program.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety; comply with random UAs.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

timeConds.notes:
* Huber for school.
* Defendant is eligible for good time credit.
- Imposed and stayed, to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Anthony Brewer

records.addlTxt: Pretrial incarceration credit; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. - not signed by defendant.

Defendant William Anthony Brewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for William Anthony Brewer.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional Statements made by N.M. and C.M. Additional Statements made by M. Crape. 

AS TO COUNT 4: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 11 YEARS, credit for 172 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 5 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 10 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction
- Court imposed and stayed 2 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
* Huber for school.
* Defendant is eligible for good time credit.

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety; comply with random UAs.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete an anger management course.
- Complete a cognitive intervention therapy program.
- Obtain a high school diploma or GED.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Complete 250 hours of community service. 

*NO CONTACT with victims.
*NO CONTACT with co-actor.

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Restitution in the amount of $6,271.81 payable to Christopher M. and $669.21 payable to Nancy M. Restitution is ordered / joint and several with co-actor Marquez L Zeigler 22CF1907.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm and body armor possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant William Anthony Brewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for William Anthony Brewer.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for sentencing. State is requesting an adjournment to allow victim to appear for sentencing. Court grants request. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant William Anthony Brewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for William Anthony Brewer.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case calendared for plea hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

AS TO COUNT 4: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 5: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.

Filed:
- Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
- Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
- Jury Instructions/Elements
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant William Anthony Brewer not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense wishes to be heard on bail. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   All conditions remain the same. Defense request a plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.   **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 28 pages) commencing 06-22-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant William Anthony Brewer in court, appear by video with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear by video.  Defendant William Anthony Brewer in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Detective M. Martin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant William Anthony Brewer not in court, in custody.  Samuel Simpson on behalf of William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Hearing as to State V. Lee. Attorney Harris has been appointed on this matter. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Anthony Brewer not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered co-defs be kept separate while in custody.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nancy M. (Victim); Christopher M. (Victim); Jatinder S. (Witness)

Defendant William Anthony Brewer in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant William Anthony Brewer in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William Anthony Brewer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Case is retabbed due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
